entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Freezing Rain Possible Tonight and Sunday in the Interior... A strong storm in the Gulf of Alaska will send a weather front north into the Interior tonight bringing warmer temperatures along with some snow and a chance of freezing rain to the area. Freezing rain will mix with the snow so no accumulation is expected, but it will create slippery driving and walking
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 15 at 8:58PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Astor remains in Major Flood stage and is expected to slowly decline while remaining in Major Flood through next week. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts through next week.

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY HEAVY LAKE EFFECT SNOW BEGINNING SUNDAY EVENING AND LASTING THROUGH MONDAY IN IRON AND ASHLAND COUNTIES... Lake effect snow showers are likely beginning Sunday evening and lasting through Monday in eastern Ashland County and throughout Iron County in northwestern Wisconsin. Two to five inches of snowfall is expected, but local amounts of six to eight inches
